topic.title: Adding Oxygen Feedback to WebHelp Generated from a Command Line

keywords.indexterm: Adding Oxygen Feedback to WebHelp output
Adding comment system to WebHelp output

body.p: To install Oxygen Feedback in your WebHelp output generated using a transformation from a command line (using the Oxygen XML WebHelp plugin or Oxygen Publishing Engine), use this procedure:

ul.li: You must have a licensed version of Oxygen XML WebHelp or Oxygen Publishing Engine.

ol.li: In the Installation page, choose the Install Feedback in WebHelp output generated from a command line option.
Create an XML file (for example, feedback-install.xml) on disk with the content generated in that Installation page.

li.p:
Reference the file you just created in a command-line transformation. There are several options for doing this:
Specify the path to the newly created XML file using the webhelp.fragment.feedback parameter in your command-line script:dita.bat ...[Other parameters]... -Dwebhelp.fragment.feedback=c:\path\to\feedback-install.xml
Specify the path to the newly created XML file using an Oxygen Publishing Template:
Create a Publishing Template, if you have not already done so. If you need help, see Working with Publishing Templates.
Copy the newly created XML file to a folder inside the publishing template's root folder.
Open the template descriptor file associated with your publishing template and add a reference to the newly created XML file in the html-fragments section.<publishing-template> ... <html-fragments> <fragment file="custom-template/feedback-install.xml" placeholder="webhelp.fragment.feedback"/> </html-fragments>
Reference the Publishing Template in your command-line script using one of the procedures found here (depending on whether your template has one descriptor file or multiple files).
Run the transformation and deploy the WebHelp output to a web server.
